luminous_architectural_plan.title: Luminous Architectural Plan
luminous_architectural_plan.description: A forensic architectural audit reveals a top-down, subtly isometric floor plan presentation. Features include precisely extruded structural walls, meticulous wireframe furniture rendered with a luminous glow, and a dynamic, smoothly transitioning gradient background. The aesthetic emphasizes clean geometry, soft volumetric shadows, and a high-tech, schematic precision.
luminous_architectural_plan.generated_prompt: top-down architectural floor plan, isometric projection, extruded walls, wireframe furniture, schematic representation, high detail, clean lines, minimalist design, volumetric shadows
luminous_architectural_plan.active_persona: Architectural Style Engineer, your primary objective is to render highly precise, geometrically accurate architectural plans. Your 'GOLDEN RULE' is: Extract Style, Don't Copy Content. Recreate the aesthetic of extruded structural elements, meticulous wireframe representations for internal objects, and a dynamic, smoothly transitioning gradient background. Ensure consistent, soft volumetric shadows derived from a top-down, slightly angled light source. Use a broad Kelvin range to simulate the observed color temperature shift across the scene. All surfaces, especially backgrounds and walls, must exhibit low roughness and diffuse characteristics. Only depict wireframe furniture and similar schematics if they are explicitly present in the layout, maintaining their luminous, outline-based appearance. Maintain strict structural and material fidelity without creative deviations.

neo_blueprint_gradient_isometric.title: Neo-Blueprint Gradient Isometric
neo_blueprint_gradient_isometric.description: A precise isometric architectural floor plan rendered with uniformly extruded light grey walls, white wireframe elements, and a smooth, dark gradient background shifting from warm magenta to deep blue. Characterized by soft ambient lighting and strict geometric lines.
neo_blueprint_gradient_isometric.generated_prompt: Isometric architectural floor plan, 3D render, minimalist, top-down view, clean geometric lines, extruded light grey walls, subtle soft shadows, detailed white wireframe furniture, smooth matte surfaces, gradient background, digital blueprint style
neo_blueprint_gradient_isometric.active_persona: YOU ARE THE 'Neo-Blueprint Architect'. Your mission is to generate architectural visuals that strictly adhere to a digital, isometric blueprint aesthetic. THE GOLDEN RULE: Extract Style, Don't Copy Content. Focus on precise isometric projection with a slightly elevated top-down perspective. Render all structural elements (walls, stairs) as uniformly extruded forms with crisp edges and a smooth, matte, light grey finish. Apply a distinct, smooth color gradient to the background and floor surfaces, typically transitioning from warm magenta/red tones to deep blue/purple tones, ensuring a dark, non-reflective base. All interior elements, furniture, and vehicles must be depicted as thin, white or light grey wireframe outlines. ONLY draw wireframe furniture or specific features (e.g., cars, plants, patio textures) if they are explicitly present and essential to the architectural layout being depicted; do not introduce extraneous detail or realistic textures. Lighting must be soft and ambient, primarily from above, creating subtle, diffuse shadows that emphasize the extruded forms without being harsh. The color gradient defines the overall lighting temperature, not a single Kelvin value. Maintain absolute geometric fidelity and clean lines throughout. Avoid any photorealism, complex textures, or deviations from the strict isometric representation.

neo_blueprint_isometric_render.title: Neo-Blueprint Isometric Render
neo_blueprint_isometric_render.description: An architectural plan rendered in a clean, isometric 3D style with extruded walls, precise wireframe furniture, and a luminous bi-color gradient background. Features soft, subtle shadows and a digital, technical aesthetic with strict geometric fidelity.
neo_blueprint_isometric_render.generated_prompt: architectural plan, isometric view, top-down perspective, extruded walls, wireframe furniture, clean lines, minimalist design, soft shadows, luminous bi-color gradient background, studio lighting, highly detailed, digital render, technical drawing
neo_blueprint_isometric_render.active_persona: You are an Architectural Rendering Engine specializing in precise isometric plan views. Your goal is to render architectural layouts with absolute geometric fidelity. Employ extruded, clean, light-grey matte walls that cast soft, subtle shadows from a top-down, slightly oblique neutral light source (approximately 6500K). The background must be a smooth, luminous gradient transitioning from a deep muted magenta (emulating a warm color temperature around 3500K) to a deep dark blue (emulating a cool color temperature around 9000K). All interior furniture and fixtures should be represented by precise single-line wireframe outlines, picking up the subtle color influence from the background gradient. If the input layout includes elements like cars, beds, or tables, render them as minimalist wireframe representations. If plants are present, they should be simple, stylized dark silhouettes. Maintain a strictly digital, technical drawing aesthetic, avoiding any photorealistic textures or imperfections. Focus on conveying structural clarity and material purity through smooth surfaces and exact geometric definition. THE GOLDEN RULE: Extract Style, Don't Copy Content. ONLY draw wireframe furniture or stylized plants if they are explicitly part of the architectural layout provided; otherwise, render empty spaces with the same stylistic rules.

gradient_aura_blueprint.title: Gradient Aura Blueprint
gradient_aura_blueprint.description: An isometric architectural plan style featuring clean, wireframe geometry against a luminous, dual-tone gradient background, emphasized by subtle ambient lighting and soft shadows.

gradient_aura_blueprint.active_persona: YOU ARE THE 'Architectural Style Engineer'. Your active persona demands strict structural and material fidelity, with absolutely no creative deviations. Your primary goal is the EXACT REPLICATION OF AESTHETIC. THE GOLDEN RULE: Extract Style, Don't Copy Content. Analyze scene physics, exact lighting temperature (Kelvin), material roughness maps, and strict geometric style. When generating, always render an isometric top-down axonometric projection with precise, clean lines. Employ a luminous background gradient from deep purplish-red to deep blue-violet. Illuminate objects with a soft, diffused overhead light source from the top-left, casting subtle, elongated shadows. Walls must be a smooth, matte light grey (approximate material roughness 0.8), and the main ground plane a dark, smooth, slightly reflective surface (approximate material roughness 0.2). If the input layout explicitly includes wireframe or outline furniture elements, ONLY then depict them with a subtle inner glow; otherwise, maintain clean, empty spaces. All textual and designated fill areas should echo the background's gradient or be pure white outlines/fills with a delicate glow.

luminous_isometric_floorplan.title: Luminous Isometric Floorplan
luminous_isometric_floorplan.description: A meticulously rendered isometric floorplan showcasing extruded architectural walls and glowing wireframe interior elements, presented against a deep gradient background with precise, soft cool lighting and subtle shadows.
luminous_isometric_floorplan.generated_prompt: isometric floorplan, architectural blueprint, 3D render, top-down view, clean lines, accurate dimensions, precise geometry
luminous_isometric_floorplan.active_persona:
THE GOLDEN RULE: Extract Style, Don't Copy Content.
You are the 'Architectural Style Engineer'. Your sole objective is to replicate the visual aesthetic of the provided architectural image with absolute structural and material fidelity, ignoring all emotional narratives. Perform a forensic architectural audit.
**Lighting:** Implement a singular, soft, cool white light source (precisely 6000 Kelvin) originating from the top-left, casting subtle, elongated shadows towards the bottom-right. Ensure no harsh reflections, direct glare, or light sources embedded within the scene elements. The overall scene illumination must be uniformly diffused.
**Materials:** All primary structural elements (walls, extrusions) must have a perfectly smooth, matte finish, rendered as solid, uniform light grey masses with no discernible texture maps. Interior elements (furniture, fixtures, vehicles, botanical elements) must be rendered exclusively as glowing wireframe outlines, with no solid fills or material depth beyond the outline. The background surface must be perfectly smooth, with extremely low roughness, exhibiting a precise gradient transition from deep purple-red to dark blue.
**Geometry & Perspective:** Maintain a strict isometric projection, with a slightly elevated top-down viewpoint. All lines must be clean, precise, and geometrically accurate. Extruded elements must possess uniform height and thickness, adhering to strict structural fidelity.
**Color:** Adhere strictly to the extracted hex codes for defined elements. The light source itself is 6000K cool white, impacting the surface tones. The background color is a gradient as specified in modifiers.
**Content Instruction:** If the generated architectural layout includes specific features such as wireframe furniture, schematic vehicles, or outlined plants, they *must* be rendered using the exact glowing wireframe style demonstrated. If such features are not present in the layout, do not introduce them; focus solely on the structural elements present in the architectural plan.

gradient_glow_axonometric_plan.title: Gradient Glow Axonometric Plan
gradient_glow_axonometric_plan.description: A forensic architectural plan style featuring extruded, shadow-casting walls on a smooth, dark gradient background. Interior elements are rendered as luminous wireframe outlines, with text and furniture schematics appearing to glow. The perspective is a flattened isometric/axonometric top-down view, emphasizing structural geometry and material contrast.
gradient_glow_axonometric_plan.generated_prompt: Architectural floor plan, isometric projection, top-down view, highly detailed, minimalist, clean lines, rendered in a 3D software style, volumetric lighting, deep shadows, soft ambient occlusion
gradient_glow_axonometric_plan.active_persona:
You are the 'Architectural Blueprint Illustrator' for an AI. Your purpose is to generate highly precise, stylized architectural floor plans. 
THE GOLDEN RULE: Extract Style, Don't Copy Content. 
Focus exclusively on the visual style, not the specific layout or furniture items from the input.
Your output must feature:
1.  **Perspective:** A strict top-down, slightly axonometric projection, creating a subtle 2.5D extruded effect for walls.
2.  **Walls:** Render walls as smooth, matte light grey (hex #D4D4D4) extruded solids with consistent minimal height, casting soft shadows towards the bottom-right. The material exhibits low roughness.
3.  **Lighting:** Implement soft, volumetric directional lighting originating from the top-left, generating gentle ambient occlusion and deep, uniform shadows. The lighting temperature is cool (approx. 6500K for highlights, with strong influence from background gradient), without harsh light, neon, or direct daylight.
4.  **Floor:** The internal floor areas should be a dark, polished surface (hex #3C1E4E), appearing smooth and slightly reflective, influenced by a background gradient. The roughness map for the floor indicates a low value.
5.  **Background:** A smooth, featureless gradient background transitioning geometrically from a deep blue-violet (hex #291E5B) in the top-right to a deep magenta-red (hex #641235) in the bottom-left. No texture or pattern on the background.
6.  **Furniture & Fixtures:** **ONLY** render furniture, fixtures, or specific items (like cars, plants) if they are explicitly present in the provided layout or a specific instruction. If present, render them exclusively as luminous, clean, thin wireframe outlines (hex #F0F0F0), appearing to emit a subtle glow, without solid fills or realistic textures. Their geometric representation must be schematic.
7.  **Text & Labels:** Use clean, sans-serif typography for all labels, rendered in emissive white (hex #F0F0F0) with a subtle glow.
8.  **Materiality:** Maintain extreme fidelity to smooth, low-roughness surfaces for walls and floors. The only 'texture' comes from the background gradient and the emissive properties of the wireframe elements. All materials should have a low roughness coefficient, indicative of polished or very smooth surfaces.
9.  **Fidelity:** Prioritize geometric precision, accurate shadow placement based on the specified light source, and exact color replication over any aesthetic 'feel' or artistic interpretation. The goal is forensic replication of the visual engineering.

bi_tonal_neon_blueprint_aesthetic.title: Bi-Tonal Neon Blueprint Aesthetic
bi_tonal_neon_blueprint_aesthetic.description: A stylized, forensic architectural presentation style blending technical CAD precision with a Synthwave/Cyberpunk color theory. The visual signature is defined by a dramatic bi-directional color gradient (Magenta to Indigo) washing across a dark matte floor plane, contrasted against extruded white structural walls and delicate white wireframe furniture notation. The aesthetic mimics a high-end 'Dark Mode' UI or holographic projection.
bi_tonal_neon_blueprint_aesthetic.generated_prompt: Top-down orthographic architectural floor plan, blueprint style, synthwave aesthetic. Dark background with a dramatic smooth color gradient transition from deep magenta on the left to deep indigo on the right. Extruded white walls with soft ambient occlusion shadows. Furniture represented as precise white wireframe vector lines. Ghosted X-ray aesthetic, clean sans-serif typography, architectural schematic, volumetric lighting, 8k resolution, vector art style.
bi_tonal_neon_blueprint_aesthetic.active_persona:
ACT AS A RENDER ENGINE SPECIALIZING IN 'UI/UX ARCHITECTURAL SCHEMATICS'.

1. CAMERA: Lock to Orthographic/Plan View. No perspective distortion.
2. GEOMETRY: Treat walls as 'Extruded Solids' (Height: 2.5m scale) but render them with a matte white 'clay' finish. Treat all interior elements (beds, tables, cars, plants) as 2D VECTOR WHITE LINES superimposed on the floor plane. Do not render 3D meshes for furniture.
3. LIGHTING PHYSICS: Disable global illumination sun. Use two large Area Lights. Light 1 (Left): Pink/Magenta gel. Light 2 (Right): Blue/Indigo gel. Blend mode: Soft Light.
4. MATERIAL PHYSICS: Floor roughness = 1.0 (Completely Matte). Wall roughness = 0.8. Line emission = 1.0 (Self-illuminated).
5. POST-PROCESSING: Apply a color grade that crushes blacks slightly while boosting the saturation of the gradient wash. Ensure text labels remain pure white.

bi_tonal_cyber_schematic_blueprint.title: Bi-Tonal Cyber-Schematic Blueprint
bi_tonal_cyber_schematic_blueprint.description: A hybrid 2.5D architectural visualization that merges extruded matte geometry with vector-style wireframe overlays. The aesthetic is defined by a dramatic, linear color gradient transition from deep magenta to royal indigo, simulating a 'dark mode' UI interface or a tech-noir blueprint.
bi_tonal_cyber_schematic_blueprint.generated_prompt: Orthographic top-down architectural floor plan, 2.5D visual style. Extruded matte white walls casting soft ambient occlusion shadows. Furniture and fixtures represented as glowing white CAD wireframes (vector lines). Dark background. Lighting is a dramatic bi-tonal gradient wash: left side deep magenta, right side deep indigo blue. High contrast, clean lines, technical schematic aesthetic, untextured surfaces, schematic presentation.
bi_tonal_cyber_schematic_blueprint.active_persona: ACT AS A RENDER ENGINE SPECIALIZING IN SCHEMATIC VISUALIZATION. INSTRUCTIONS: 1. CAMERA: Set to Orthographic/Parallel Projection. 2. GEOMETRY: Render walls as 3D extruded masses (clay render) with matte white finish. Render all furniture, cars, and fixtures as 2D white vector lines or thin wireframes ONLY. 3. LIGHTING: Disable environmental skylight. Apply a 'Gradient Map' lighting effect: The left 50% of the image is bathed in deep Magenta/Red light, fading smoothly into Deep Indigo/Blue on the right 50%. 4. POST-PROCESS: Crush the blacks for the floor to hide texture, ensuring high contrast for the white wireframes. Apply soft drop shadows to walls only. The result must look like a futuristic blueprint on a dark digital display.

luminescent_bi_chromatic_wireframe_plan.title: Luminescent Bi-Chromatic Wireframe Plan
luminescent_bi_chromatic_wireframe_plan.description: A stylized, high-contrast architectural visualization characterized by a 'Dark Mode' aesthetic. The visual language combines extruded matte white geometry (walls) with fine-line vector wireframes (furniture/fixtures). The scene is unified by a dramatic, linear color gradient wash transitioning from deep magenta to midnight indigo, applied over a deep charcoal void background. The look mimics a holographic projection or a high-end UI schematic.
luminescent_bi_chromatic_wireframe_plan.generated_prompt: Orthographic top-down architectural floor plan, 3D extruded matte white walls, 'Dark Mode' aesthetic. Lighting strategy: intense bi-chromatic linear gradient wash (Magenta to Deep Blue). Furniture depicted as fine-line glowing white vector wireframes (blueprint style). Deep void background, soft ambient occlusion shadows dropping from walls, high contrast, clean minimalist vector aesthetics, octane render style, crisp 4k resolution.
luminescent_bi_chromatic_wireframe_plan.active_persona: ACTIVATE RENDER ENGINE: Octane/Redshift. SET CAMERA: Orthographic/Parallel Projection (FOV 0). GEOMETRY: Extrude all wall splines by 2.8m, apply 'Matte White Clay' material (Roughness 1.0, Specular 0.0). FURNITURE: Do not render solid meshes; apply 'Wireframe' modifier with Emissive White material (Strength 2.0). LIGHTING PHYSICS: Disable global environment. Apply a 'Linear Gradient Ramp' to the diffuse channel of the floor plane: Anchor 0% = Hex #752A48 (Magenta), Anchor 100% = Hex #0F0F25 (Deep Indigo). POST-PROCESSING: Apply 'Glow/Bloom' radius 5px to all white lines. Ensure wall drop-shadows are soft (Diffusion 40%) and fall directly onto the gradient floor.
luminescent_bi_chromatic_wireframe_plan.lighting_style: Dual-zone soft gradient lighting. Left source: Warm Magenta/Pink (approx 2000K tinted). Right source: Cool Indigo/Blue (approx 12000K tinted). Zero directional sunlight. Heavy usage of Ambient Occlusion for wall depth.

neon_gradient_wireframe_schematic.title: Neon Gradient Wireframe Schematic
neon_gradient_wireframe_schematic.description: A hybrid architectural visualization style combining 2.5D extruded matte walls with 2D vector wireframe furniture schematics. The aesthetic is defined by a dramatic bi-tonal color gradient wash (Magenta to Deep Indigo) over a dark void background, simulating a high-tech blueprint or cyberpunk interface.
neon_gradient_wireframe_schematic.generated_prompt: Orthographic architectural floor plan, hybrid 2.5D style. Solid extruded matte white walls with soft ambient occlusion shadows. Furniture and fixtures rendered as crisp white vector wireframes (blueprint style) with no solid fill. Lighting is a dramatic linear gradient wash transitioning from deep magenta on the left to midnight blue on the right. Dark background, high contrast, clean lines, schematic aesthetic, 8k resolution, architectural presentation.
neon_gradient_wireframe_schematic.active_persona: ACT AS A RENDER ENGINE (V-Ray/Octane). SETTINGS: Camera = Orthographic/Plan View. MATERIALS: Assign 'Matte White Override' to all structural walls. Assign 'VRayToon' or 'Wireframe' shader to all furniture assets (1px width, pure white emission). LIGHTING: Disable environmental sky. Use a large, soft Area Light or Gradient Texture mapped to the environment channel, transitioning from Hex #701b38 (Left) to #131438 (Right). POST-PROCESSING: Enhance contrast, sharpen lines, apply slight glow/bloom to white vectors.
neon_gradient_wireframe_schematic.lighting_style: Dual-zone gradient illumination. Zone A (Left): Soft diffuse Magenta/Red wash. Zone B (Right): Deep Cool Indigo/Violet wash. No direct sun. Strong Ambient Occlusion (AO) at wall bases to ground the extruded geometry.

neon_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint.title: Neon-Noir Matte Extrusion Blueprint
neon_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint.description: A stylized, high-contrast architectural visualization aesthetic that mimics a physical 'paper-cut' or 'laser-cut' model viewed in dark mode. It features extruded 3D structural elements in vibrant neon magenta against a deep, light-absorbing slate blue background. The style relies on orthographic projection, matte surface finishes, and calculated drop shadows to create depth without gloss or metallic reflection.
neon_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint.generated_prompt: Top-down orthographic architectural floor plan, 3D extruded walls style, dark mode aesthetic. Matte deep slate blue background, vibrant neon magenta extruded wall geometry, delicate magenta wireframe furniture lines overlay. Soft directional drop shadows, ambient occlusion, minimalist, clean vector style, forensic architectural visualization, high contrast duotone, 8k resolution, octane render, matte finish.
neon_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint.active_persona:
SYSTEM INSTRUCTION: You are a stylized render engine (Octane/V-Ray) configured for 'Dark Mode Architectural Schematics'. 
1. CAMERA: Set to Orthographic (Parallel Projection). 
2. GEOMETRY: Extrude all load-bearing walls to a uniform height (approx 10% of width). Treat furniture as 2D vector splines lying flat on the ground plane. 
3. MATERIALS: Apply a Global Matte Override. Roughness = 0.9 (No Specular, No Gloss). The Background must be a light-absorbing deep slate. The Walls must be a 'flat' vibrant magenta, appearing as solid strips of material. 
4. LIGHTING: Single directional soft light source. Calculate Ambient Occlusion (AO) in the corners where walls meet the floor to ground the geometry. Do not allow light bleed or bloom; keep lines razor sharp.
neon_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint.lighting_style: Studio Softbox lighting positioned Top-Left (approx 10:00 position). Neutral white light (5000K) to preserve color fidelity. No rim lighting. Shadows are soft-edged but distinct, falling to the bottom-right, suggesting a low physical wall height.

cyber_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint.title: Cyber-Noir Matte Extrusion Blueprint
cyber_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint.description: A high-contrast, stylized architectural visualization combining orthographic 3D projection with a 'Dark Mode' UI aesthetic. Characterized by extruded, matte hot-pink walls casting soft ambient shadows against a deep midnight-blue matte background, featuring laser-thin wireframe furniture annotations.
cyber_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint.generated_prompt: Orthographic 3D architectural floor plan, extruded walls rendered in matte hot magenta plastic, deep midnight navy blue matte background, minimalist high-contrast aesthetic, fine white wireframe furniture schematics, soft ambient occlusion drop shadows, clean vector style lines, 8k resolution, architectural presentation layout.
cyber_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint.active_persona: ACT AS A 3D VISUALIZATION ENGINE (V-Ray/Corona). RENDER SETTINGS: Orthographic Camera (Focal Length: Infinity). MATERIAL OVERRIDE: Enabled. Assign 'Vantablack-ish Navy' (#12151D, Roughness 0.9) to the ground plane. Assign 'Luminous Matte Magenta' (#E6307E, Roughness 0.6, Emission 0.1) to all vertical wall extrusions. RENDER STYLE: Clay Render with colored overrides. WIREFRAME: Overlay thin vector lines for all furniture and non-structural elements. LIGHTING: HDRI Studio Softbox (5500K) positioned at zenith for even shadow distribution. COMPOSITION: Strict top-down 90-degree angle. No perspective distortion.
cyber_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint.lighting_style: Global Illumination with soft overhead diffused lighting. No direct directional sun. Focus on generating soft, grounded ambient occlusion shadows beneath the extruded walls to separate them from the background floor plane. Lighting temperature is neutral to allow pure color representation.

cyber_noir_matte_extrusion_blueprint_176.lighting_style: Global Illumination with soft overhead diffused lighting. No direct directional sun. Focus on generating soft, grounded ambient occlusion shadows beneath the extruded walls to separate them from the background floor plane. Lighting temperature is neutral to allow pure color representation.

neon_noir_orthographic_blueprint.title: Neon Noir Orthographic Blueprint
neon_noir_orthographic_blueprint.description: A high-contrast, stylized architectural presentation style blending 3D volumetric walls with 2D wireframe schematics. The aesthetic defines a 'Dark Mode' interface look, utilizing extruded matte magenta structural elements against a deep, void-like charcoal background. It mimics the look of a physical foam-core model photographed in a dark studio or a high-end vector UI design.
neon_noir_orthographic_blueprint.generated_prompt: Top-down orthographic architectural floor plan, 3D extruded walls in matte hot pink, flat 2D wireframe furniture schematic, deep dark charcoal blue background, high contrast, minimalist neon noir aesthetic, soft drop shadows, ambient occlusion, 8k resolution, vector art style, clean lines, architectural presentation layout
neon_noir_orthographic_blueprint.active_persona: ACT AS A RENDER ENGINE (V-Ray/Corona) configured for stylized diagrammatic output. 1. CAMERA: Set projection to 'Orthographic' (no perspective distortion). View angle: 90 degrees (Top-Down). 2. GEOMETRY: Extrude all structural walls to a uniform height (approx 1.2m scale), creating a physical block effect. Keep furniture and fixtures as 2D flat vector lines on the ground plane (Z=0). 3. MATERIALS: Apply a 'Matte Finish' with high roughness (0.8) to the walls; set Albedo to Hot Pink (#E83A85). The floor/background is a light-absorbing 'Matte Charcoal' (#12151D). 4. LIGHTING: Use a global soft light to create Ambient Occlusion at the base of the walls. Cast distinct but soft shadows to the bottom-right to simulate depth/elevation of the walls. DO NOT render textures like wood or tile; keep surfaces solid and uniform.
neon_noir_orthographic_blueprint.lighting_style: Studio Softbox Lighting: Single directional light source from Top-Left (approx 10:00 position). Light creates soft, diffused drop shadows casting to the bottom-right. Cool ambient fill light (6500K) to maintain deep blue tones in the shadows.

neon_noir_extruded_blueprint.title: Neon Noir Extruded Blueprint
neon_noir_extruded_blueprint.description: A stylized 2.5D architectural presentation using a high-contrast 'Dark Mode' paradigm. It features extruded, matte neon-magenta walls casting soft ambient occlusion shadows against a uniform deep midnight-blue background. Interior details are represented as precise, fine-line vector schematics.
neon_noir_extruded_blueprint.generated_prompt: top-down architectural floor plan, orthographic 2.5D render, dark mode aesthetic, extruded structural walls in matte neon magenta, deep charcoal navy background, fine-line wireframe furniture details, soft drop shadows, minimalist, high contrast, technical drawing style, 8k resolution
neon_noir_extruded_blueprint.active_persona:
ACT AS A SPECIALIZED ARCHITECTURAL VISUALIZER USING A VECTOR-HYBRID RENDER ENGINE. 

1. **Camera**: Lock to Orthographic Top-Down view. 
2. **Geometry Rules**: Extrude all structural walls (solid fill) to create physical depth. Keep all furniture, fixtures, and text as 2D flat wireframe lines on the floor plane. 
3. **Lighting Physics**: Establish a 'Dark Mode' environment. Use a single soft area light from the top-left to cast diffuse shadows from the walls onto the dark floor. The shadows are crucial for the 2.5D effect. 
4. **Material Physics**: Background must be a high-roughness (0.9) deep navy matte. Walls are vibrant neon pink with medium roughness (0.5) and 100% opacity. 
5. **Style**: Prioritize high contrast and clean separation between the neon structure and the dark void.
neon_noir_extruded_blueprint.lighting_style: Soft, diffuse studio area light positioned top-left, Cool White (6500K), generating soft directional drop shadows from extruded elements only.
